de.hu.logic.modal
Class SetEvaluation

java.lang.Object
  de.hu.logic.modal.SetEvaluation

public class SetEvaluation
extends java.lang.Object

This is a very simple evaluation algorithm that evaluates the formula from the inside out in the most naive way. Note that if the formula uses a proposition symbol that is not part of the signature of the TransitionSystem (nor a fixed-point variable) then no error is generated but the propositions is considered to be false on all vertices.

Author:
Stephan Kreutzer

Method Detail

evaluate

public Proposition evaluate(TransitionSystem trans,
                            Formula f)
                     throws EvaluationException
The main method of the class. Call this method to evaluate the formula f in the transition system trans.

Parameters:
trans - Transition system
f - Formula to evaluate
Returns:
Returns the relation containing the set of vertices at which the formula becomes true.
Throws:
EvaluationException - Exception thrown if for some reason the formula cannot be evaluated in the system. See EvaluationException class description for the various reasons why this can happen.

checkSignatures

protected boolean checkSignatures(Formula f)
                           throws EvaluationException
Checks if the transition system provides the relations used by the formula.

Parameters:
f - Formula to be ckecked.
Returns:
true if the formula matches the signature of the transition system.
Throws:
EvaluationException - Throws an exception in case of an error.

recursiveEvaluate

protected Proposition recursiveEvaluate(Formula f)
The main evaluation function. The method evaluate checks the signature first and then calls this method to do the actual evaluation.

Parameters:
f - Formula
Returns:
returns the set of vertices satisfying the formula.
